title: Smurf Partners requested
body:
Hi guys, 

I'm Diamond lvl player. I want to smurf. But I want to smurf with people that are either also smurfs themselves or are down on their luck. I want to add a few people that regularly play ranked but seem to be stuck in Bronze or Silver. People that always get feeders or afks, people that say "Rito Plz"

I'm here to be the robin hood of elo, and give you guys a break.

I like to use voice comms - so over 18 preferred because I'm 26 and don't want to be chatting to 12vies.

I don't want to give away my smurf accounts name so I'm not flooded with requests. But if you think you might want to duo/trio with me just reply and tell me a bit about yourself and your IGN and I'll add you.

For example here's a little about me:-
I like to drink, play games, voice chat and have some laughs and enjoy carrying games. I like to play all roles at low elo but I particularly excel as ADC and mid as they're my main roles. I'm white, but I like to name myself IKYU so that people think I'm azn think I'm good at this game!

replies.body:
I agree with total virgin about how you need to learn from your mistakes, at the same time, iKyu could teach the low elo players in scrims or non ranked games. Instead of boosting them to a higher level... All the newbees will be just sitting back and watch him carry as their ranks grow... When iKyu is gone that same person will go back down to their original ranked and before you know it quit.

So morale to the story guys, just do scrims and be a team player and make there on your own, you will feel much better about your achievement.

Read about the glitch that happen to faker i think it was, hacker got into his acc and put him on b5...before you know it during the time riot was fixing his acc faker made almost back up to his normal elo.

what this story explained is, everyone gets a bad game but you need to accept your rank instead of saying " i should be a gold or plat".

Once again regardless of who is going to carry you to plat or dia, you will always fall or stay to your according rank, unless you've become bettee that is :).

Hope i have achieved something with this post :)

You're also narcissistic, self centered and a lame wad. Smurfing is queer on every level. Have a bit of fairness for the REAL new players who are learning. You're such a discouraging person to be around. Ill stay unranked rather than play with people like you.
But wouldn't players who are learning be able to learn more from a higher level player than a lower level one?

> [{quoted}](name=whitePumah,realm=OCE,application-id=mR0UmRrp,discussion-id=YnxiqeiE,comment-id=00030001,timestamp=2016-04-20T05:09:08.574+0000)
>
> But wouldn't players who are learning be able to learn more from a higher level player than a lower level one?

To a degree, but thats what the inbuilt system is for and bots, and forums... we dont need a high elo player in lower levels to teach, you need to give people a fair chance to make mistakes and learn, not get dominated by people that know all the champs, meta strats, item builds, objective plays etc.

Edit: Also smurfing isnt dropping your ranked elo, smurfing is new accounts leveling, not 30's in ranked. So he wants to drop his elo, or get dropped into a lower bracket and play players with less ranked skill than him... Or boost you to his rankings and watch you get stomped... 

It's not a good play style, its not sportsmanlike and frankly... it's just sad.

I decimate smurfs like him without a problem.

I always prefer to vs harder opponents, remember ranked is not for fun its competitive for you to get better.

I never claimed too, this account is 6weeks old after stopping for near 3 years. Yet i seem to know quite alot about the game for someone with just over 100 wins... 

Wonder how that happened? Could it be i have years of play experience and knowledge of the game anyways?
